original_text:
CTSurg-Discharge Summary
**INSTITUTION
Patient :
**NAME[AAA , BBB] B
MRN - **ID-NUM - MPACCOMMMRN
Age :
**AGE[in 30s] years
Sex :
Female
DOB :
**DATE[Apr 12 1977]
Author :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Discharge Information
Admit Date :
**DATE[Sep 17 2007]
Operative Date :
**DATE[Sep 17 2007]
Discharge Date :
**DATE[Sep 23 2007]
Discharge Diagnosis :
S/p tricuspid valve repair
K annuloplasty .
s/p atrial septal defect repair
Primary repair .
repair of pulmonary valve with autologous pericardium
Post Operative Patient Care Issues
Atrial Fibrillation
Immediately post - operatively .
Resolved with Cardizem gtt .
Past Medical History
ASD , pulmonary stenosis , trace AI
Health Status
Allergy / reaction profile ( all ):
NKA
Canceled / inactive reactions :
Unable to Obtain
Admission Information
Reason for Admission
Patient was referred to **NAME[YYY ZZZ] , MD .
Patient was worked up as an outpatient after experiencing complaints of SOB .
After all the risks and benefits were discussed , patient consented to proceed with tricuspid valve repair , atrial septal defect repair and repair of pulmonary valve .
Patient was admited on **DATE[Sep 17 2007] .
Hospital Course
Operating Room
On **DATE[Sep 17 2007]  , the patient was taken to the operating room .
The patient underwent tricuspid valve repair K annuloplasty atrial septal defect repair primary closure repair of pulmonary valve using autologous pericardium .
Surgery was performed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ] , MD .
Surgeon was assisted by **NAME[VVV UUU] , MD .
ICU course
Within 24 hrs the patient was successfully extubated from mechanical ventilation , was neurologically intact and hemodynamically stable .
The patient was taken back to the operating room later on the operative day for continued chest tube drainage / bleeding .
Post op course
Standard management
Once upon unit 6D the patient received aggressive pulmonary toileting and gentle diuresis
The following were consulted for ways of increasing ambulation and activity :
Physical Therapy , Occupational Therapy and Cardiopulmonary Therapy .
Diet was advanced as tolerated
On the monitor the patient remained in normal sinus rythm ( After the short run of Afib in the CTICU immediately post - op ) .
Post op complications
A small pneumothorax was discovered on CXR on POD#3 .
Since patient was asymptomatic , the patient would be watched .
Discharge Plan
Discharge Diagnosis :
S/p tricuspid valve repair ( K annuloplasty ) .
S/p atrial septal defect repair ( primary closure ) .
Repair of pulmonary valve with autologous pericardium .
Disposition
Patient discharged to home .
Discharge Orders and Instruction
Condition : stable .
Diet : regular .
Discharge heart rhythm : normal sinus rhythum .
Activity
The patient is to increase activity slowly as tolerated
Elevate legs when sitting
Climb stairs as necessary
Do not lift anything greater than 5 pounds for four weeks or until otherwise cleared by a physician
**DATE[Jan] engage in sexual intercourse when strong enough
**DATE[Jan] take short rides in car
Do not return to work .
Check with your physician on your first follow - up appointment
Don 't drive a car until after your first doctor appointment
Instructions
Continue incentive spirometry treatments 4 times a day for 10 repetitions
Please refrain from smoking
Weigh daily ; record weight
Use Aspirin ONLY AS DIRECTED by Doctor
Wash incisions with a mild soap and water .
Do not use lotions , creams , or powders on incision line
Limit alcohol consumption
Do not cross legs or wear tight stockings or socks
You may use Acetaminophen for headaches or minor pains as per directions
Call physician if ANY of the following are noted
Heart rate greater than 110 beats / min or less than 50 beats / min
Increased swelling , redness , or drainage at or around the incision site
Weight gain 3 lbs / day or 5 lbs / wk
If any signs or symptoms of infection are noted regarding the surgical incisions please call your Cardiothoracic Surgeon
Unusual rashes
Nausea or vomiting
Fever associated with chills
Temperature elevation greater than 101 F degrees or sustained low grade temperature of 100 F degrees or higher
New onset chest pain
Lightheaded / dizziness
New or increased shortness of breath
Severe calf pain
Burning on urination
Severe depression
Medications
Lopressor 25 mg po bid
Plavix 81 mg po qd
Colace 100 mg po bid PRN for constipation
Vicodin one tablet po q 6 hrs PRN for pain
Tylenol 650 mg po q 6 hrs PRN for discomfort
Pepcid 20 mg po bid x 2 weeks
Follow Up
Patient to see Primary Care Physician , **NAME[TTT SSS] , MD in 2 weeks (  **PHONE )
Patient to see Cardiologist , **NAME[RRR QQQ] , MD **PHONE in 4 weeks
Patient to see Cardiothoracic Surgeon , **NAME[YYY ZZZ] , Md in 4 weeks .
Home Care :
The patient will have home health care visiting two times a week for two weeks .
They will do a complete physical assesment , check incisions , and review medications during each visit .
Any remaining sutures or staples must be removed in seven days .
Laboratory work to be obtained once weekly for two weeks :
Hemoglobin , Hematocrit , Creatinine and Potassium .
These results go to the Primary Care Physician Dr. **NAME[TTT SSS] , MD .
Condition upon discharge :
The patient was stable for discharge .
All discharge instructions were given , patient and / or family verbalized understanding
Time spent with patient on day of discharge :
Greater than 30 minutes .
Professional Services
Credentials and Title of Author **NAME[PPP] Signing this **NAME[OOO]: NNN] , CRNP
Perform by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Sep 23 2007] 15:37 )
Sign by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Sep 23 2007] 15:37 )
VERIFY by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Sep 23 2007] 15:37 )
